poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Brusque? He would scrub the event and the venue,
Leave you to busk on some sub-zero, underground ramp.
The buck won't stop, though music might.
Lie looking up: the next bunk is too close to your nose;
What's it to be - some bulk with a club?
Or a Burke & Hare job? The suspense.
